dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3230 RH: Financial Institution Regulatory Tailoring Enhancement Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Barr (for himself and Mr. Meuser) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on May 7, 2025

form.official-title: To increase the asset thresholds at which financial institutions become subject to certain requirements, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Financial Institution Regulatory Tailoring Enhancement Act.

subsection.text: The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 1025(a) (12 U.S.C. 5515(a)), by striking $10,000,000,000 each place it occurs and inserting $50,000,000,000; and
in section 1026(a) (12 U.S.C. 5516(a)), by striking $10,000,000,000 each place it occurs and inserting $50,000,000,000.

subsection.text: Section 13(h)(1)(B)(i) of the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 (12 U.S.C. 1851(h)(1)(B)(i)) is amended by striking $10,000,000,000 and inserting $50,000,000,000.
Section 129C(b)(2)(F)(i) of the Truth in Lending Act (15 U.S.C. 1639c(b)(2)(F)(i)) is amended by striking $10,000,000,000 and inserting $50,000,000,000.
Section 201(a)(3)(A) of the Economic Growth, Regulatory Relief, and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5371 note) is amended by striking $10,000,000,000 and inserting $50,000,000,000.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
